moves.1. d4: fatcat2 vs slockster, I have never won against fatcat2 despite having played him 22 TIMES!!!!! Maybe from this annotation you may understand why, please help me, I can't bear to lose 23 times
moves.1... f5: I open with dutch, this was the first time I had used this opening, so perhaps I wasn't as prepared as I thought I might be, still, here goes
moves.2. g3: White opens g pawn to allow for bishop hole, this also creates a very strong defence for the king when castled
moves.2... d5 3. Bg2 Nf6 4. c4: white seeks to destroy my centre pawns or get them away from the centre
moves.4... dxc4: d5? error by me, I should have stayed and held out with perhaps 4.Nc6 5.cxd5 Nxd5 6.Bxd5 Qxd5
moves.5. Qa4+: a clever attack, regains pawn and creates powerful centre
moves.7. Bf4 Qa5+ 8. Qc3: If you play me at chess you will probably notice that I am unhappy to trade queens so early on, mainly because I'm lazy and no queens usually results in a longer game
moves.8... Qb5: the real aim here was to disallow white from moving his queen, for threat of Qxb2
moves.9. Nd2: this threat however is now gone
moves.9... Ne4: error by me, loses pawn due to bishop
moves.10. Nxe4 fxe4 11. Bxe4: white now has a sizeable area in the centre and has devloped a lot more that black
moves.11... Bg4: I think it needs to be more subtle, Qxe2checkmate seems to cry out
moves.12. f3 Be6 13. Bd3: threatens queen, black is now being pushed back a long way
moves.14. e4: white has now captured the centre
moves.14... Qh5: pointless due to protection by knight on f3, black just didn't want to retreat
moves.15. g4 Qh4+ 16. Bg3 Qf6 17. e5: queen is being bullied around the board by mere pawns and is now back to here own pawn files
moves.17... Qh6 18. Qb4: what did white mean to achieve by this move? I'm not sure
moves.18... Qe3+: mind you, what did I mean to achieve from this move!
moves.20... Bc4: checkmate dawns on e2, but it will never have a chance to take place
moves.21. Bf2: queen is yet again forced to retreat
moves.21... Qf4: every single move from this point on was a conditional move
moves.22. Qc8+: now the black king is on an enivitable course that will lead to its destruction
moves.22... Kf7 23. Bxc4+ Kg6: black has no options and little time
moves.24. Qe8+ Kg5 25. Qh5#: and that =s how I lost yet another horrific battle against  opimus felix duos (fat cat 2) but every cloud has a silver lining....right?
